meanings.definition: Modesty or shyness resulting from a lack of self-confidence.
meanings.sent1: Her diffidence made her blush when complimented on her artwork.
meanings.sent2: His diffidence often led him to avoid speaking up in class discussions.
meanings.sent3: Despite her diffidence, she managed to give a heartfelt speech at the event.
meanings.sent4: The diffidence in her voice betrayed her true feelings of nervousness.
meanings.sent5: The diffidence in his demeanor made him endearing to those around him.

meanings.definition: Hesitation or reluctance in asserting oneself.
meanings.sent1: The candidate's diffidence during the debate was evident to the audience.
meanings.sent2: She overcame her diffidence and boldly presented her innovative idea.
meanings.sent3: His diffidence in accepting the award was met with warm applause.
meanings.sent4: The diffidence in his actions spoke louder than words.
meanings.sent5: The diffidence in her stance softened the intensity of the situation.
